questions.question: What is a one-tailed hypothesis test?

answers.a: A hypothesis test that uses a one-sided alternative hypothesis.
answers.b: A hypothesis test that uses a two-sided alternative hypothesis.

explanations.a: A one-tailed hypothesis test is a hypothesis test that uses a one-sided alternative hypothesis, focusing on detecting a significant difference or relationship in one specific direction.
explanations.b: This statement is incorrect. A one-tailed hypothesis test uses a one-sided alternative hypothesis, not a two-sided alternative hypothesis.

questions.question: What is the power of a hypothesis test?

answers.a: The probability of rejecting the null hypothesis when it is true.
answers.b: The probability of failing to reject the null hypothesis when it is false.

explanations.a: The power of a hypothesis test is the probability of rejecting the null hypothesis when it is false, indicating the ability of the test to detect a significant difference or relationship when one exists.
explanations.b: This statement is incorrect. The power of a hypothesis test is not the probability of failing to reject the null hypothesis when it is false but the probability of correctly rejecting it when it is false.

questions.question: What is the formula for the test statistic in a one-sample t-test?

explanations.a: The formula for the test statistic in a one-sample t-test is t = (sample mean - hypothesized mean) / (standard error). It measures the difference between the sample mean and the hypothesized population mean in terms of the standard error.
